project_name: py-libp2p: The Python libp2p Stack for Filecoin & IPFS
filecoin_growth_impact:
py-libp2p contributes to the Filecoin economy by expanding the number of developers and applications that can build on and interact with the network. While py-libp2p itself does not directly process FIL-denominated transactions (as it is a networking layer rather than a storage or deal execution layer), it enables Python-based applications to participate in Filecoin storage, retrieval, and coordination workflows.

By making libp2p and content addressing accessible in Python—the dominant language in AI, scientific computing, data processing, and research—we are increasing the range of workloads and datasets that can be stored and exchanged over Filecoin. This includes federated learning pipelines, academic datasets, and decentralized research collaborations now prototyping storage flows backed by Filecoin.
Numerical Estimate of Economic Impact (Nov 2024 – Sept 2025):

~10 active weekly users currently integrating Filecoin-enabled workflows through py-libp2p.

50+ contributors and research collaborators gaining familiarity with Filecoin/IPFS protocols.

Multiple academic and enterprise teams now designing data and compute workflows that result in new and recurring Filecoin storage usage (ongoing growth trajectory).

In short, the economic value of py-libp2p is network demand growth: it brings new developer groups into the Filecoin ecosystem, enabling applications that will store more data, run more retrievals, and expand real usage over time.
description: py-libp2p delivers a native Python implementation of the libp2p networking stack, making Filecoin and IPFS accessible to the large Python ecosystem of researchers, data scientists, and distributed systems developers. Between November 2024 and September 2025, we focused on stability, interoperability, and spec alignment, enabling reliable peer discovery, secure transports, and data exchange across networks. These improvements have powered new decentralized storage, federated learning, and distributed AI applications built on Filecoin & IPFS infrastructure. By maintaining core libraries (py-libp2p, py-multiaddr, py-cid), we reduce onboarding friction, expand developer reach, and unlock real experimentation and production deployment in Python-first environments.
additional_impact:
Beyond core library maintenance, py-libp2p has played a meaningful role in education, ecosystem expansion, and applied decentralized systems development across the Filecoin network. The project has been adopted into curriculum at NSUT (Delhi), where students learn IPFS, libp2p, and Filecoin networking using the Python implementation, helping train the next generation of Filecoin-native developers and researchers. We have collaborated with teams across Protocol Labs, Huddle01, Storacha, LF Edge, NVIDIA, DataBricks, and multiple academic institutions, strengthening the ecosystem through shared prototyping, research, and interoperability work.

py-libp2p has also supported real deployments and applied systems, including federated learning + Filecoin-backed data sharing, Storacha’s Proof-of-Contribution and decentralized care coordination platform, and early components of the Filecoin Onchain Cloud and Warm Storage SDK. We further contributed to interoperability work between Filecoin and Ethereum P2P stacks, enabling cross-network research and experimentation.

We actively participate in Filecoin EngRes knowledge-sharing and onboarding, improving developer workflows and ensuring Python support remains aligned with evolving ecosystem needs. Additionally, maintainers have represented Filecoin in public forums as keynote speakers at the Research Conclave (NSUT × Royal Society of Chemistry) and as judges and invited experts at the Industrial Ideathon held by the Government of NCT of Delhi, helping expand awareness of Filecoin in academic and policy innovation circles.

Overall, py-libp2p contributes not only code, but education, community leadership, and sustained ecosystem cohesion—broadening who can build on Filecoin and how.
end_user: The primary end users of py-libp2p are Filecoin builders, researchers, and developers who require native Python support to integrate decentralized storage, retrieval, and networking into their applications. This includes Python developers building P2P, storage, or networking systems that depend on libp2p primitives; AI/ML engineers and data scientists who store, share, and federate datasets and models on Filecoin/IPFS using Python toolchains; and research labs and academic groups prototyping distributed experiments and reproducible data pipelines. It further supports decentralized application builders connecting Python-based services to Filecoin/IPFS, DevOps and infrastructure teams operating Filecoin Onchain Cloud or distributed compute stacks, and educators and students learning peer-to-peer networking with approachable Python examples.
testimonials:
We have received strong positive testimonials from contributors and developers across the Filecoin, IPFS, and broader decentralized systems ecosystem. To date, there are 15+ public testimonials acknowledging the importance and impact of maintaining a Python-native libp2p stack. These include feedback from Protocol Labs researchers, Huddle01 engineers, NVIDIA and DataBricks AI practitioners, NSUT & NSUT IIF academic teams, the IPFS-kit-py team, LF Edge open-source contributors, and engineers from Ethereum’s lean libp2p working group and Starknet team.

These testimonials consistently highlight that py-libp2p lowers the barrier for Python developers to integrate Filecoin and IPFS, enables research and prototyping in AI and distributed systems, and expands the ecosystem beyond Go/Rust-centric development.

Link to compiled testimonials: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1WAA0dLDMVNyVb3SklJIiL8PNOQB58lX9?usp=drive_link
top_five_dependents:
Top 5 High-Impact Projects Dependent on py-libp2p (and companion libraries py-cid / py-multiformats):

IPFS Toolkit & Dataset Frameworks in Python (ipfs_kit_py and ipfs_datasets_py)
 These toolkits integrate py-cid and py-multiaddr to make Filecoin/IPFS storage directly accessible in Python data science, ML training, and reproducible research pipelines.

Federated & Distributed Machine Learning Pipelines (P2P-Federated-Learning)
Research labs at NSUT and university clusters use py-libp2p for coordinating decentralized model training, while Filecoin/IPFS store datasets and checkpoints. This enables privacy-preserving collaborative AI workflows.

OP Medicine / OP NodeKit developer tools on Optimism & Filecoin experimenting with py-libp2p as the P2P and MCP transport layer

Decentralized Container Orchestration with Filecoin, IPFS and Ethereum (Veil Stack / Eth PeerFlow / Filecoin Storacha SDK): Python-based orchestration services use py-libp2p for peer discovery, node coordination, and secure task execution across distributed compute networks.

Crypto-Economic Coordination & Proof-of-Contribution Systems (Storacha / Eth Elder Ease / PoC Networks)
 py-libp2p enables trust-minimized messaging, identity, and contribution accounting for decentralized reputation, caregiving systems, and community-driven resource coordination.

Additional ongoing integrations:

Universal Connectivity experiments linking Filecoin storage and Python-based peers across heterogeneous networks

Eth Maintenance Project (supported by Code for Gov Tech) leveraging py-libp2p in civic digital infrastructure research

Hypertensor Subnet Framework (Decentralized AI Subnets)
 A Python framework using py-libp2p for encrypted peer-to-peer subnet communication and workload distribution across decentralized AI compute meshes.

Full list of active integrations and project references:
 https://github.com/seetadev/awesome-libp2p-adoptions/blob/main/Py-libp2p-RETROPGF_IMPACT.md
filecoin_users_percentage_using_project:
py-libp2p is not currently used as a primary networking implementation by production Filecoin storage providers, and therefore we do not represent a measurable percentage of nodes on the Filecoin network. Instead, the impact of py-libp2p is in ecosystem expansion and developer onboarding — enabling Python developers, researchers, and AI/ML teams to build, prototype, and experiment with Filecoin and IPFS networking without needing to adopt Go or Rust.

Our contribution strengthens the network by growing new developer entry points and enabling new application categories (scientific data workflows, federated learning, decentralized research clusters), rather than increasing the node count of storage providers.
